alert.note: Alert for Buckeye, Avondale; Sonoran Desert Natl Monument; Tonopah Desert (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 13 at 2:55PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Maricopa County through 345 PM MST... At 255 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Palo Verde, or 13 miles south of Buckeye. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Buckeye, Tonopah, Palo Verde, Painted Rock Dam, Perryville, Palo Verde Nuclear Generation Station, Wintersburg, Hassayampa, and Arlington. This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 10 between mile markers 95 and 121. AZ Route 85 between mile markers 139 and 154. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Buckeye, Avondale; Sonoran Desert Natl Monument; Tonopah Desert
